note:
I'm Zed Sehyr. I'm at San Diego State University. I do research on how languages (signed & spoken) are processed in the brain. I study the American Sign Language lexicon and how signers organize or represent signs in their mental lexicon.

I work with machine learning engineers, computer vision scientists & deaf people to develop linguistically informed tools for automatic sign recognition.

I'm hearing, and my languages are English, Czech & ASL.
